SENT.plain: It may sometimes be difficult to diagnose low risk MDS in patients with mild cytopenia
We report on 10 patients with mild to marked, unexplained cytopenia without definitive signs of a myeloid neoplasm
In two patients, a karyotype-abnormality (trisomy 14; monosomy 7) was detected in a small subset of bone marrow cells
Progression to overt MDS was seen in two patients including the one with monosomy 7
In the remaining cases, no MDS developed in a follow-up of at least 6 months
The phrase "idiopathic cytopenia of undetermined significance (ICUS)", as also suggested by Mufti and co-workers, is proposed and long term follow-up is recommended to assess the evolution
